fields.description:
To replicate:

# Attach a word document, save with Japanese characters in the filename
# Use Firefox, edit attachment in Word
## Attached document will open as a new, blank document
# Use IE, edit attachment in Word
## Attached document will open as expected
fields.summary: Edit in Word opens blank page if editing attachment with Japanese filename from Firefox

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23712]. {panel} Steps to reproduce: # create a new page, enter two paragraphs of text, e.g: {code}

foo

bar

{code} # now select both these paragraphs using Ctrl + A or Cmd + A # copy and then paste back into the same editor # this will result in this markup: {code}

foo

bar

foo

bar

{code} Reproducible in Chrome 14 and 15.
fields.summary: Copy and paste content in editor results in indented text and undesirable markup being entered

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23711].
  {panel}

Embedded Crowd should only copy or sync groups that actually serve a purpose within Confluence (or Jira). Currently all groups of every user are synced. Only a very small percent of these groups are actually used by Confluence for Space or Page restrictions. 

Its very likely that Confluence DB could easily keep track of the groups that are actually used for Space or Page restrictions then embedded crowd only copy/sync those.

Our LDAP is huge, and we are not able to restrict group filter by OU or group name because the groups that are used by confluence to control permissions are scattered, and not in our control to duplicate or rename. Implementation of embedded crowd copied many thousands of groups into Confluence for absolutely no purpose within Confluence. This is a huge security concern as well as a deviation from an otherwise stellar product.

Login was taking upwards a minute because embedded crowd was attempting to sync massive groups that serve absolutely no purpose within Confluence. Once the group filter excluded these login dropped to an acceptable duration, but still thousands upon thousands of groups are sync'ed for no reason at all. Editing the UD group filter is very difficult when one wishes to negate most of their entire LDAP!

PLUS a GROUP SEARCH filter is very badly needed on the Manage Groups page!


Thank you,
Craig
fields.summary: Embedded Crowd should only copy or sync groups that actually serve a purpose within Confluence.
Renaming "Show Descendents" option in Children Display Macro to "Show All Descendents" option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23709].
  {panel}

h3.Problem.

Links that are from Confluence itself, or placed by user should be redirected instead of a direct link.

e.g. http://www.google.com should be https://myconfluence.com/?redirect=http://www.google.com

This would avoid security checks from browser and would avoid annoying warnings.
fields.summary: Links from External reference should be redirected instead of direct link, due security matters.

fields.description:
During editing, inserting a page link - User Interface is too small, so it's not possible to visualize long page names. So if we have many pages that are long and begin with the same just becoming different at the end of the name, isn't possible to know which page we are picking from the list.

This register is related with the support case CSP-70795. Please, see the screen-shot attached to better understand as an example.
fields.summary: UI too small - not possible to visualize page names correctly
Enable cluster performance tests for stable

fields.description: I've been playing with the new RTE and attempting to reuse it within a plugin, quite successfully in-fact. Although I came across an odd situation where the storage to editor renderer (editRenderer bean) is not directly available as an autowired component to plugins (I had to dig it out with the ComponentManager), yet the EditorConverter to convert editor format back to storage format is. This seems like an odd arrangement, surely the editRenderer should also be autowired.
fields.summary: editRenderer is not available to plugins, yet editConverter is
Logical sorting of lucene index items for people in Share feature

fields.description:
User macros appear to be ignoring the default value, this leaves an undefined value that is that is passed verbatim in the html. For example, the line ## @param width:title=Width|type=string|default=600|desc=Width in pixels plus this invocation (note: width not set) {iframetest:source=http://www.evernote.com|height=500} produces this code {noformat}


View full page

{noformat} "paramwidth" has passed through to the html as unknown I'll document the full example iin a comment.
fields.summary: Default user macro parameters ignored

   1. go to dashboard
   2. mark a space as favourites by clicking on the star
   3. click the star again to unselect it
   4. go to the my tab, the space still remains selected
   5. refresh the dashboard, the space still remains as a favourite

Workaround listed in this [document|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Spaces+Cannot+Be+Unmarked+as+Favourites] can be used to bypass issue:

   1. Visit the space.
   2. Locate the pull down menu on the top right hand corner and select {{Browse}} >> {{Advanced}}.
   3. In the Advanced console, locate the {{Remove Space}} from {{Favourites}} menu (bottom left) and click it.

fields.description:
Pressing the backspace key immediately after inserting a link causes undesirable behaviour.  

Chrome 13 and 14:
After selecting some text (double-click a word), then adding a link with *insert link*, pressing backspace to remove the trailing link underscore actually causes all text after the cursor (up to the end of the paragraph) to disappear.

Firefox 6 and 7:
After selecting some text (double-click a word), then adding a link with *insert link*, pressing backspace to remove the trailing link underscore actually causes the cursor to move to the end of the paragraph.

Internet Explorer 8:
After selecting some text (double-click a word), then adding a link with *insert link*, pressing backspace to remove the trailing link underscore actually does nothing until you click it again and then it removes the entire link underline.

I often select entire words by double clicking them.  This highlights the entire word (and, unfortunately the space following the word).  Inserting a link into the selection causes the trailing space to also have a link underline.  I found that when I press backspace to remove the underscore that the remaining paragraph to the right of the cursor disappears (Chome 14).

Reproduce:
# *Edit a page in Chrome 13 or 14*
# Select a word in the middle of a plain text paragraph by double-clicking the word
# Select Insert->Link and choose another page in confluence, click Insert
#* Note that an extra space following the word is underlined
# Press backspace to remove the space
#* Note that the paragraph following the cursor has vanished

# *Edit a page in Firefox 6 or 7*
# Select a word in the middle of a plain text paragraph by double-clicking the word
# Select Insert->Link and choose another page in confluence, click Insert
#* Note that an extra space following the word is underlined
# Press backspace to remove the space
#* Note that the cursor has jumped to the end of the paragraph and backspaced the last character in the paragraph.

# *Edit a page in Internet Explorer 8*
# Select a word in the middle of a plain text paragraph by double-clicking the word
# Select Insert->Link and choose another page in confluence, click Insert
#* Note that an extra space following the word is underlined
# Press backspace to remove the space
#* Note that the cursor doesn't move
# Press backspace again
#* Note that the entire link underline is removed
# Press backspace again
#* Note the space is removed
fields.summary: After creating link in editor the backspace removes paragraph text after the cursor in editor 4.0.3

fields.description:
The Javascript plupload.js in confluence-drag-and-drop-1.0.16.jar sets the mimeType variable for Office 2007/2010 documents like so:

application/vnd.openxmlformats,docx pptx xlsx

But this isn't a valid MIME type for these documents.  instead, it should follow the definitions from Confluence's own mime.types file:

application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet               xlsx
application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.template            xltx
application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.presentationml.presentation       pptx
application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.presentationml.slideshow          ppsx
application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.presentationml.template           potx
application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document         docx
application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.template         dotx


This causes big problems for CMIS attachment integration and 3rd party previewers.
fields.summary: Drag-and-Drop upload sets incorrect mimeType for Office 2007 and 2010 documents

The Confluence API has a VersionHistorySummary object:
http://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/latest/com/atlassian/confluence/core/VersionHistorySummary.html

What we wanted to do is pull out all the versions of a page, and decide to do certain actions based on whether each version was a minor or major revision. It seems that this state is not exposed out to the API. 

Can you add this state in future API versions?

fields.description:
In the HTML generated for PDF export, pages are structured/wrapped in a way that makes pages 'cousins' - not siblings. This means that CSS generated section numbering is broken because the counters lose scope in the present structure.

The requirement for section numbering is a big issue for some customers, judging by comments on:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Editing+the+PDF+Stylesheet

e.g.:
Niall Teskey  Mar 26, 2010

Can you say which version of Confluence you were using? I have tried this with 3.0 and the counters are re-set on every page, so I get 1s and 0' as in the previous POST. If it works on 3.2 then I will take the pain of upgrading.

I did try to check this out on the on-line sandbox but I couldn't see the PDF Stylesheet edit, just the HTML headers and footers.


Vladimir Alexiev  Apr 05, 2011

Has anyone been able to make section numbering work? The above doesn't work for me: section counters are reset for every wiki page (only sections within a page are incremented).
fields.summary: Change the way that pages are structured in the HTML export so that CSS generated numbering will work

fields.description:
In versions of Confluence prior to Confluence 3.5, a version of Atlassian Application Links was included that featured the ability to automatically turn textual references to entities in other applications into hyperlinks (for example, you could type "{{PROJECT-123}}" into a Confluence page and, if you had an entity link configured to a matching JIRA project, the issue key would be transformed into a hyperlink to "http://my-jira/browse/PROJECT-123" when the page was viewed).

This feature was removed from Atlassian Application Links 3.0, which is the version of Application Links that was shipped with Confluence 3.5.

Any customer that upgrades to Confluence 3.5 from an earlier version will find that any application links such as this that were visible on their Confluence pages have now reverted back to plain, unlinked text.

A new, separate plugin was written for JIRA to restore this functionality (https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/559566), but it doesn't work in Confluence.
fields.summary: Application Link Link Rendering does not work in Confluence 3.5 or higher

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23692].
  {panel}

In the status macro, the user can set macro colour as well as the title (i.e. the text that appears on the lozenge)

The usability of this would greatly increase if users were able to allocate colour - title pairs.

For example
|| Colour || Title||
| Red | Failure |
| Green | Pass |
| Yellow | In Progress |
| Grey | On hold |
| Grey | Not started |

When one half of these pairs are specified, the user will have to only specify colour or title and the corresponding status or colour (respectively) will be invoked.

For example, if the current status is
Red / Failure

The user would only have to switch to Green to get a status of
Green / Pass

Currently, a user has to change both the colour AND the status manually resulting in a more cumbersome user experience.
fields.summary: Allow status macro title field to correspond to a particular colour and vice versa

The description pasted from the [documentation here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Connecting+to+an+Internal+Directory+with+LDAP+Authentication#ConnectingtoanInternalDirectorywithLDAPAuthentication-MembershipSchemaSettings]:

||Setting|Description||
|Group Members Attribute|The attribute field to use when loading the group's members. Example:
member|
|User Membership Attribute|The attribute field to use when loading the user's groups. Example:
memberOf|
|Use the User Membership Attribute, when finding the user's group membership|Select the check box if your directory server supports the group membership attribute on the user. (By default, this is the 'memberOf' attribute.)
If this check box is selected, your application will use the group membership attribute on the user when retrieving the members of a given group. This will result in a more efficient retrieval.
If this check box is not selected, your application will use the members attribute on the group ('member' by default) for the search.|

The last option does not seem to apply the configuration. It just skips it and doesn't bring the Groups a user belong.
fields.summary: "Use the User Membership Attribute, when finding the user's group membership" does not work when enabled in User Directory.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23678].
  {panel}

We are using Confluence to capture and publish project documentation from different field engineers. Our dashboard has a number of spaces, one of which is "Field Engineering". We you enter that space you are presented with a tree of pages where we list projects. 

The top-level page for ProjectA is given as:

    http://abc.xyx.com:8080/display/FIELD/ProjectA

The top-level page for ProjectB is given as:

    http://abc.xyx.com:8080/display/FIELD/ProjectB

Creating a "Background" page for ProjectA would create the URL:

    http://abc.xyx.com:8080/display/FIELD/Background

Creating a situation where ProjectB would would have to call its "Background" page something else simply to avoid a collision on the URLs.

If the page name is to be used for the URL, it should be used relative to its location in the tree. Something like:

http://abc.xyx.com:8080/display/FIELD/ProjectA/Background
http://abc.xyx.com:8080/display/FIELD/ProjectB/Background
fields.summary: Disassociate page name and URL to allow two pages with the same name to exist with different URLs.

fields.description:
Here are the following steps on how to reproduce this problem:
# Create a new Confluence page 
# Insert all Russian words inside
# Select some content to be the headings (Heading 1 to Heading 6)
# Insert a Table of Contents macro
# Save the page
# Clicking on the Table of Contents link on any of those Russian headings does not kink to the right headings and it will only ended up being kinked to the first Table of Contents link
# Upon further investigation, it looks like the URL of the Table of Contents link is broken when you have all Russian words as headings
|

As a workaround, you will need to have either digits or normal alphabets inclusion into the Russian headings and the URL of the Table of Contents link will not be broken anymore. 

*This problem does not occur in Confluence 3.5.x and below*.
fields.summary: Table of contents macro does not link to headings in Russian words

fields.description:
I have a plugin that uses web panels (a {{vm}} file) in the Edit Dialog. When I upgrade the plugin, the old version of the template include in the panel is included/rendered :(

The only way I have managed to get the new version of the template to get included/rendered is restarting the server. I've attached a couple of plugins to reproduce.

This is how the panel is defined:
{noformat}
<web-panel key="brokenPanel" location="atl.editor" name="Broken panel in edit window">
    <resource name="view" type="velocity" location="templates/panel.vm"/>
</web-panel>
{noformat}

*Steps to Reproduce*
* Install Plugin version 1.0
* Go to any page, and edit it, you'll get an alert message, showing _"Version 1.0"_, which is defined in the {{panel.vm}} file.
* Install Plugin version 2.0 (the {{panel.vm}} file has been updated to include _"Version 2.0"_)
* Go to any page, and edit it, the alert message will still show _"Version 1.0"_.
* Restart server
* Go to any page, and edit it, the alert message will finally show _"Version 2.0"_.
fields.summary: web-panels do not get upgraded after plugin upgrade

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23668].
  {panel}

I often need to search my Confluence site, to see where a specific macro is used, or to find a specific use of a given macro. I used to be able to do that by enclosing my search in double quotes and entering the relevant bit of wiki markup.

For example:
* To search for all inclusion macros that include the page called "_QRG_Colour", I just entered the following text into the search box:
"include:_QRG_Colour"
* To search for all inclusion macros, I entered "{include".
* To search for all children macros, I entered "{children"

This no longer works, or at least I can't find a way of making it work. Please restore the functionality or document a workaround. It is essential for maintaining technical documentation.

An alternative would be for Confluence to provide a cross-reference, maybe at space level, of where each macro is used.
fields.summary: Cannot do site-wide search for macros used on pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23661].
  {panel}

[Confluence Data Model page in CAC|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Data+Model] needs to be updated:

General Database Diagram - The diagram is outdated. There are new tables introduced since Confluence 3.5 and one more new table introduced in 4.0 as listed below:
|| Table Name || Description || Version Notes ||
| CWD_APP_DIR_GROUP_MAPPING \\ | Groups assigned to each application. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_APP_DIR_MAPPING \\ | Directories assigned to each application. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_APP_DIR_OPERATION \\ | Application-level permissions for adding, modifying and removing users, groups and roles from a directory. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_APPLICATION \\ | All applications listed in Crowd. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_APPLICATION_ADDRESS \\ | Remote addresses currently assigned to each application. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_APPLICATION_ATTRIBUTE \\ | Attributes for an application. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_DIRECTORY \\ | All directories listed in Crowd. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_DIRECTORY_ATTRIBUTE \\ | Attributes for a directory. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_DIRECTORY_OPERATION \\ | Permissions for adding, modifying and removing users, groups and roles from a directory. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_GROUP \\ | Groups from internal directories. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_GROUP_ATTRIBUTE \\ | Attributes for a group. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_MEMBERSHIP \\ | Group members from internal directories. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_USER \\ | Users from internal directories. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_USER_ATTRIBUTE \\ | Attributes for a user. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_USER_CREDENTIAL_RECORD \\ | Hashed passwords for each user. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| LOGININFO | Information of user login. | Introduced in Confluence 4.0 \\ |
fields.summary: To Update Confluence Data Model Page In CAC

fields.description:
h2. Problem description
This error occurs in new installations of 4.0-4.0.3 where, in the setup wizard, the user has opted to install the demo space.  This can also happen during an upgrade from a pre 4.x Confluence installation but is rare.

Here are the steps that you can take to reproduce this bug :

# Install a clean instance of Confluence 4.0.3. (Installed by following the setup wizard, and set user management to 'Manage Users and Groups within Confluence')
# Access {{Browse>Space Directory}} and there will be an error. The stack trace is as follows :

{code}
org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getBodyAsString' in  class com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.SpaceDescription$$EnhancerByCGLIB$$f653be5e threw exception java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: The body of this ContentEntityObject ('') was 'BodyType:XHTML' but was expected to be 'BodyType:WIKI' at /templates/spacedirectory.vm[line 62, column 71]
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.handleInvocationException(ASTMethod.java:337)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:284)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.execute(ASTReference.java:262)
...	
Caused by: java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: The body of this ContentEntityObject ('') was 'BodyType:XHTML' but was expected to be 'BodyType:WIKI'
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.ContentEntityObject.getBodyContent(ContentEntityObject.java:169)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.ContentEntityObject.getBodyAsString(ContentEntityObject.java:206)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.ContentEntityObject$$FastClassByCGLIB$$96df24d5.invoke(<generated>)
	at net.sf.cglib.proxy.MethodProxy.invoke(MethodProxy.java:149)
	at net.sf.hibernate.proxy.CGLIBLazyInitializer.intercept(CGLIBLazyInitializer.java:108)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.SpaceDescription$$EnhancerByCGLIB$$f653be5e.getBodyAsString(<generated>)
	... 197 more
{code}

h2. Workaround:
# Uninstall the current 'demonstration space' provided with the installation
# Install the 'demonstration space' attached to this bug report ([ds-154834-2.xml.zip|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/66557/ds-154834-2.xml.zip])

If the above does not work, then another space has unconverted description.  In this case please refer to the workaround in the related issue CONF-24282.

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23650]. {panel} This bug is usually encountered when you copy and paste from another web page which contain invisible anchor links. Anchor links normally appear on big pages which begin with a table of contents of links to allow a user to quickly navigate to the relevant section of the page. The anchor link will typically be declared above or near the headings on this page. If you copy and paste a section that includes a heading, it is likely you have also copied an anchor. To know for sure, you can view the HTML source of the page if you are comfortable doing this. To reproduce this bug: # Open the [attached test.htm|^test.htm] file. It has an invisible anchor markup: . Notice the anchor has a start and end element with an empty body. Also notice it is not an empty element: i.e.
fields.summary: Confluence serves anchors to the browser as an empty element <a name="..." /> which the browsers don't handle very well leading to all subsequent text being rendered as a link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23645].
  {panel}

Confluence CLI is being used, but it doesn't do much other than call the *addAttachment* Remote API service. The [documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Confluence+XML-RPC+and+SOAP+APIs] says:
bq. Note that this uses a lot of memory - about 4 times the size of the attachment.

Can attach files around 3 MBs, but problems when larger files. 13 MBs fails (see https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/CSOAP-114). I attempted 23 MBs with a 4GB java heap size. Same file can be attached via UI fine.

{noformat}
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space; nested exception is: 
	java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
	at org.apache.axis.message.SOAPFaultBuilder.createFault(SOAPFaultBuilder.java:222)
	at org.apache.axis.message.SOAPFaultBuilder.endElement(SOAPFaultBuilder.java:129)
	at org.apache.axis.encoding.DeserializationContext.endElement(DeserializationContext.java:1087)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.endElement(AbstractSAXParser.java:601)

	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLDocumentScannerImpl.next(XMLDocumentScannerImpl.java:648)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLNSDocumentScannerImpl.next(XMLNSDocumentScannerImpl.java:140)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanDocument(XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.java:511)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(XML11Configuration.java:808)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(XML11Configuration.java:737)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.XMLParser.parse(XMLParser.java:119)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(AbstractSAXParser.java:1205)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.jaxp.SAXParserImpl$JAXPSAXParser.parse(SAXParserImpl.java:522)
	at javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser.parse(SAXParser.java:395)
	at org.apache.axis.encoding.DeserializationContext.parse(DeserializationContext.java:227)
	at org.apache.axis.SOAPPart.getAsSOAPEnvelope(SOAPPart.java:696)
	at org.apache.axis.Message.getSOAPEnvelope(Message.java:435)
	at org.apache.axis.handlers.soap.MustUnderstandChecker.invoke(MustUnderstandChecker.java:62)
	at org.apache.axis.client.AxisClient.invoke(AxisClient.java:206)
	at org.apache.axis.client.Call.invokeEngine(Call.java:2784)
	at org.apache.axis.client.Call.invoke(Call.java:2767)
	at org.apache.axis.client.Call.invoke(Call.java:2443)
	at org.apache.axis.client.Call.invoke(Call.java:2366)
	at org.apache.axis.client.Call.invoke(Call.java:1812)
	at org.swift.common.soap.confluence.ConfluenceserviceV2SoapBindingStub.addAttachment(ConfluenceserviceV2SoapBindingStub.java:4857)
	at org.swift.confluence.cli.ConfluenceClient.addAttachment(ConfluenceClient.java:1707)
	at org.swift.confluence.cli.ConfluenceClient.addAttachment(ConfluenceClient.java:1646)
	at org.swift.confluence.cli.ConfluenceClient.handleRequest(ConfluenceClient.java:471)
	at org.swift.common.cli.AbstractRemoteClient.process(AbstractRemoteClient.java:119)
	at org.swift.common.cli.CliClient.doWork(CliClient.java:225)
	at org.swift.confluence.cli.ConfluenceClient.main(ConfluenceClient.java:115)
{noformat}

h4. Workaround
- Attach the file through Confluence interface
- Use "doattachfile.action" controller using a tool like [curl|http://curl.haxx.se/], so your command line would look like:

{noformat}
curl -F file_0=@<path to file> -F pageId=<confluence page id> -u <username>:<password> "http://Confluence-URL/pages/doattachfile.action"
{noformat}
or,
- Use WebDAV and intermediary mean to upload/attach files. For more details on this, please review the following docs:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+WebDAV+client+for+Confluence
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Uploading+Data+via+WebDAV

fields.description:
* Create Page1 with content: {noformat}{excerpt}a{excerpt}{noformat}
* Create Page2 with content:
{noformat}* {excerpt-inlude:page=Page1|nopanel=true} b{noformat}
* Save the page, and confirm there is a space between the a & b characters
* Edit Page2, and add a new indented bullet below the first line
* Save the page

There is no longer a space between the a & b characters. If you insert a new space, it will again be lost when saving the page.

Reproduced on FF only. 


Version = 4.0.3
URL = http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/~mhrynczak/page2
Browser = Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
fields.summary: Spaces are lost when using an excerpt-include macro in a list

fields.description:
When starting a new line with a text link and you would like to place some normal text before the texted link, in Firefox, it does not allow you to do this, it formats your text as part of the link.

This occurs in the Text Editor as well as comments.

Tested on Firefox 7. in Chrome it does not do this.
fields.summary: Link Text Errors in Editor/Comments

fields.description:
Clicking 'Select All' or 'Deselect All' affects all groups, not just the one that you're selecting.

This appears to be triggered by groups with periods, ampersands or spaces in the group name (other characters could have the same affect). Removing these characters or replacing them with hyphens seems to resolve the problem.
fields.summary: 'Select All' or 'Deselect All' in Space Permissions affects all groups

fields.description:
The \{code:xml\} macro renders XML schema locations incorrectly.  The following example illustrates the behavior.  Consider the following wiki source:

\{code:xml\}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
\{code:xml\}

The above snippet renders incorrectly by truncating the schema location and creating malformed XML:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
        xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
        xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 >

It's interesting to note that placing a space _before_ the closing quote provides a workaround:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd ">
fields.summary: {code:xml} Macro Renders XML Schema Locations Incorrectly

fields.description: We have many pages containing <code>-panels with xml documents in them. In the editor they are rendered fine. If opening preview we get an error message, afer saving (what creates no error) the document is somewhat cropped. See attached screen-shots.
fields.summary: Regresssion: <code:xml/> broken after upgrade to confluence 4.0

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23619].
  {panel}

{quote}if you attach a pdf (probably all other attachement types are affected as well) to a page where the filename contains a umlaut like "äüö.pdf" you cant:
 * link to that attachment (link is greyed out and does not work)
 * view it (returns a "Page Not Found" error)
 * remove it (returns a "Not Permitted: You are not permitted to perform this operation." error)
 * view/edit properties (returns a {code}java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.MoveAttachmentAction.bootstrap(MoveAttachmentAction.java:112){code} should i include the full stack trace?
{quote}

***Workaround***
Cloud users will need to create a [support ticket|https://support.atlassian.com] for us to apply the workaround. Please provide a suitable downtime for a maintenance update when creating the support ticket.
fields.summary: german Umlaute in attachments broken

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new blog post in Confluence 4.0
# Run the following query against the database to list all created blogs sorted by CREATIONDATE:
{code}
SELECT TITLE, CREATIONDATE, LASTMODDATE
FROM CONTENT
WHERE CONTENTTYPE='BLOGPOST'
AND PREVVER IS NULL
ORDER BY CREATIONDATE;
{code}
# The timestamp of newly created blog post is set to 00:00:00 e.g. [^SQL1.png] 

The issue does not occurred in Confluence 3.5.x. This seems to be broken in 4.0.
fields.summary: Blogpost Creation Timestamp is set to 00:00:00 in CREATIONDATE column

fields.description:
We created an Application Link from Confluence 3.5.13 to JIRA 4.4.1 and the JIRA icon appeared in the editor for a Wiki page. We can search for issues successfully. When we create an issue, the components data is populated correctly but creation fails with "Reporter is required". If I change the JIRA instance to make Reporter an Optional field for the chosen JIRA project then we can create an issue but its Reporter field is set to Anonymous. Our userids are identical in both systems and use the same AD server.

I've searched the documentation and forums/answers but without success. What else could cause the reporter not to get passed to JIRA?
fields.summary: Creating new issues in Confluence does not pass the reporter to JIRA

fields.description:
In a case that my customer is facing, someone added "User A" into Confluence through LDAP, and set "User A" as a watcher for a space or a page. However, when "User A" is deleted from LDAP, the user still exists in Confluence, but not as "User A", instead as "{fullName}()". 

I have found a workaround, that is to delete the user from the 'notifications' table of the database, but that only works if you know the username of "User A". In the case of my customer, they do not monitor all the deleted users, so this method does not work for her.

I have been able to reproduce this issue locally, and I have included some screenshots of what happens.

I hope that this bug will be able to be fixed soon.
fields.summary: Watcher not deleted in Confluence if the user is deleted from LDAP
Wrong avatar shows up in "Share" email notifications for Apple Mail and iPhone email client

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23602].
  {panel}

Looking at the internals of our PropertySet implementation I've discovered that after retrieving an instance of a PropertySet, any subsequent calls to setXXXX() on the PropertySet can trigger duplicate OS_PROPERTYENTRY rows to be inserted with the same identifier (not, its not the creation or fetching of the PropertySet instance, but the invocation of setXX() that triggers the insertion). 

There also appears to be issues with concurrently updating an existing PropertySet (but I can't explain why yet). 

These two issues has caused the introduction of thread synchronisation (an example can be found in DefaultLoginManager.onSuccessfulLoginAttempt()). 

We should consider introducing this synchronisation on our PropertySet implementation or some other solution that will address the above two issues (obviously thread synchronisation will not fix the issue in a cluster).
fields.summary: Duplicate PropertySets with the same identifier can be created

fields.description:
Cancelling out of autocomplete within a sentence, then pressing backspace places the cursor at the end of the sentence. 

Steps to reproduce:
# Type a sentence of text
# Move the cursor in between any of the words of your sentence
# Type any autocomplete trigger (\!) or ([)
# Now cancel out of it (press ESC) and hit backspace to delete it

Outcome: 
*In Firefox*
Cursor jumps to the end of the sentence

*In Chrome*
Chrome looses focus of the editor and tries to take you back to a previous page! 

Expected outcome: Should just delete the character you typed, cursor remains in the same place 

Attached is a video in Firefox
fields.summary: Cancelling out of autocomplete and pressing backspace puts the cursor at the end of your sentence
